job_details.degree_required: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field

jd: From: Rohit Kumar Bid, Vyze Inc rbid@vyzeinc.com Reply to: rbid@vyzeinc.com Job Title: Mainframe z/OS SpecialistLocation: Owings Mills, MD Hybrid 2 days a week in Owings Mills, MDDuration: 12+ MonthsVisa: USC/GC/GC EADMy Summary based off the JD: Mainframe z/OS Specialist• Location: OM Corporate Campus 3 (2 days/week in office preferred; fully remote possible)Key Requirements:• Main Focus: Expertise in Mainframe z/OS, with proven experience as a DB2 Database Administrator on z/OS 2.4+ and DB2 z/OS V12.• Tools Required:• Broadcom/CA mainframe tools (e.g., RC/Merger, RC/Query, RC/Migrator, Detector, Subsystem Analyzer)• Rocket Software tools (ASG-TMON/MVS, TMON/DB2)• IBM DataStudio is a plusResponsibilities:• Provide on-site database and system support for IBM DB2 on z/OS• Maintain capacity and performance, troubleshoot, and perform system backups• Participate in 24x7x365 on-call rotation for production support• Support software/database installation, upgrades, and patchingQualifications:• Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field• 6+ years of experience with IBM DB2 z/OS administration• Strong SQL and performance tuning skills• Excellent documentation and communication skillsOfficial JDFocus:This position will be focused primarily on the Mainframe z/OS platform. Demonstrated experience as Database Administrator in DB2 on z/OS 2.4 or higher, and DB2 z/OS V12.This is the job summary written up by the manager:Preferred:Certification as Database Administrator in DB2 z/OS at V11 through current.Working experience with mainframe DBA tools from Broadcom/CA required– including• RC/Merger• RC/Query• RC/Migrator• Detector• Subsystem AnalyzerStrong knowledge of SQL and performance tuning.Participation in 24x7x365 oncall rotation required.Also tools from Rocket Software including ASG-TMON/MVS, TMON/DB2, IBM – DataStudio are Preferable.Summary:The main function of a Database Administrator is to provide database support on a variety of hardware and software platforms and peripherals.Job Responsibilities:• Provide database and system on-site support of the IBM DB2 mainframe z/OS environments• Support numerous IBM application environments & teams leveraging DB2 z/OS databases• Monitor, collect statistical information, and provide reporting on capacity and system performance• Based on statistics, make recommendations to maintain and improve capacity and system performance• Monitor the system, and act upon system and application automated alerts• Perform diagnostics, testing, and troubleshooting of software, o/s, and database issues (ex. correcting installation, configuration, or data problems)• Plan and perform software installation, configuration, upgrade and patching• Plan and perform database configuration, maintenance, upgrade and patching• Perform and manage system and database backups• Perform manual switch to redundant system / database components, in case of system failures• Participate fully in 24x7x365 oncall rotations for production supportQualifications:• Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required• 6+ years’ experience required including use of all IBM Utilities and Commands in an administration and architecture role• Experience in providing technical support, covering database administration and operations to include monitoring maintenance capacity, performance monitoring/planning and incident/problem troubleshooting and resolution• Strong knowledge of SQL and tuning• Knowledge of IBM Data Studio, Broadcom/CA database administration tools, TMON monitoring• Understanding of Help Desk tools and trouble ticket tracking processes• Understanding of support agreements and their implied service levels• Proven ability to write excellent technical documentation• Excellent written and verbal skills• Ability to express complex technical concepts effectively• Ability to work well with people partnering and collaborating on solutions from many difference disciplines.• Ability to work well with people from many different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience• Ability to work independently and as part of a team• Ability to mentor others• Action and results oriented• Ability to exercise good judgement while under stress• Knowledge of mainframe database products including CA DB2 tools, TMON monitoring, Data Studio is preferred.
